abstract: A number of new tablets geared toward businesses are expected to give the iPad, which has had the market largely to itself, a run for its money.
snippet: A number of new tablets geared toward businesses are expected to give the iPad, which has had the market largely to itself, a run for its money.
lead_paragraph: SAN FRANCISCO  The billboards promoting the iPad have a simple message: The tablet is a device for leisure, to be held on one’s lap while lounging on a couch in casual clothes, to watch a film or read a magazine.

headline.main: After iPad’s Head Start, Rival Tablets Are Poised to Flood Offices
headline.print_headline: After iPad’s Head Start, Rival Tablets Are Poised to Flood Offices

abstract: Magazine publishers have a tough choice: an exclusive, pricey deal with the wildly popular Apple conduit, or Google’s open, less expensive and less trafficked vehicle.
snippet: Magazine publishers have a tough choice: an exclusive, pricey deal with the wildly popular Apple conduit, or Google’s open, less expensive and less trafficked vehicle.
lead_paragraph: Digital subscriptions, a grail for the mainstream media that often seemed more like a mirage, took on some firm if not altogether friendly dimensions last week.

abstract: Why keeping your brilliant business idea a secret may doom it to failure.
snippet: Why keeping your brilliant business idea a secret may doom it to failure.
lead_paragraph: You’ve heard of high-tech start-ups being in “stealth mode,” meaning they’re not telling anyone what they’re up to yet. It has a glamorous aura to it, conjuring up images of a brilliant project in the works that will soon be sprung upon the world, disrupting established players and leaving everyone scrambling to catch up. All smart companies with really great innovations keep those ideas hidden away until they’re ready to release them, lest competitors steal them. Look at Apple, which has perfected the art of secretiveness, to enormous profit. You can tell people about your great idea — but only if they sign one of those nondisclosure agreements you keep in your briefcase at all times. No exceptions!

headline.main: Got a Great Idea? Tell Everyone!
